title: How to adjust the screen size in Fortnite
text:
An old bug has reared its ugly head… (Picture: Epic)

The new season of Fortnite has begun and Chapter 2 is here, much to the excitement of fans everywhere.

However, it seems that this update has brought the return of an old bug, with many console users finding that they’re having a hard time getting the right screen size.

For any players out there having issues with it, here’s how to adjust your console screen size so you can get back to enjoying the game.

How to adjust the screen size in Fortnite for PS4

Find the Game menu

Switch ‘Uncap Framerate’ on

Switch ‘Invert View’ on

Click ‘Apply All Changes’ by hitting Triangle

Before you start playing, turn both of the above settings off again.

This should fix any screen size problems by updating the screen’s resolution and forcing it to readjust.

How to adjust the screen size in Fortnite for Xbox One

Advertisement

Advertisement

Find the ‘System Settings’

Click ‘Display and Sound’

Click ‘Video Output’

Click ‘Calibrate HDTV’

Click ‘Next’ to scroll through screen options to find the one that fits your screen

Save your chosen setting
